question: Which of the given statements are true regarding the power of CBI for conducting investigation?
option1: It requires prior approval of Central Government for investigating officers of the rank of joint secretary
option2: No prior sanction required to conduct a probe against senior bureaucrats under Prevention of Corruption Act
answer: No prior sanction required to conduct a probe against senior bureaucrats under Prevention of Corruption Act
explanation: Earlier, CBI was required to get the prior approval of the Central Government before inquiring an officer of the rank of joint secretary and above in the Central Government. Later, Supreme Court held it to be invalid on May 6, 2014 and allowed CBI to conduct investigation against senior bureaucrats under the Prevention of Corruption Act.
